hive_lesson.title: 15 Telling Time
hive_lesson.description: Two people talk about when they do things.

hive_text_custom.text: : First, when do you get up?
: Yeah, I get up early too. I don't get up at 7:30, but I get up at 8:00.
: Oh, well, sometimes I get up at 8:00. Maybe at the weekend.
: Yeah. Actually, I always wake up at 6:00. I wake up very early, but I don't get out of bed. I wake up. I have some water, and then I sleep some more. I sleep two more hours.
: Sometimes I wake up at 7:30 and I play on my phone for maybe an hour.
: I read that it's not good to check your phone in bed. I never check my phone in bed.
: What about breakfast? When do you eat breakfast?
: I usually eat breakfast at around 8:30, but sometimes I don't have breakfast.
: I usually have breakfast right away. I wake up at 8:00 or I get out of bed at 8:00 and then I eat something at 8:15. I eat something as soon as I get up.
: Oh. No. I usually have to wait before I can eat.
: Well, I always eat and I always have coffee very early.
: Do you have coffee every day?
: Every day. I have three cups of coffee. I have one cup of coffee around 8:00. I have another cup of coffee around 10:00 and then I have my last cup of coffee around 2:00 or 3:00.
: Yeah. My office is by a café and the café has really good coffee. I love their café mochas.
: Oh, I really don't like the taste of coffee, but I do love a hot chocolate.
:  Oh, I hear you. When do you start your day at work or school?
: Well, I work as a teacher, so I start at 9:00 a.m.
: Yeah, it's okay. I work for a few hours in the morning and lunch comes by really quickly. How about you? When does your day start?
: Well, I have two jobs. Now, I make websites and I work at an office. I start at 12:00, so noon. I start my day late. I finish working at 8:00 or 9:00 at night.
: I wish I started work at 12:00, but I don't think I'd enjoy working so late.

: Oh, it's great. I love it, because there's no traffic at noon when I go to work and there's less traffic at night when I come home. I finish at 9:00 and the train is not crowded and it's really nice.
: How long does it take to get to work?
: It takes 15 minutes by train. If the weather is nice, on nice sunny days I walk to work, it takes one hour and I walk home, it takes another hour.
: It is nice. I like to walk to work and I like to walk home. I work at night, so I eat dinner really late. I eat dinner at 10:00 and that's very late and a little unhealthy. When do you eat dinner?
: Well, yeah, 10:00 p.m. is really late. I'm usually in bed at that time. I usually have dinner I'd say maybe 7:30 p.m.
: Wow. You have dinner before I finish work.
: I know, but if I don't eat at that time, I get really cranky.
: Yeah, most nights, but at the weekend, I usually go to bed later. I'd say midnight, sometimes 1:00 a.m. or 2:00 a.m.
: Wow. That's interesting, because on workdays, Monday to Friday, I go to bed late, but on the weekend, my days off, I go to bed early.
: Yeah. On Saturday night and Sunday night, I go to bed at 10:00, but Monday to Friday I work, I go to bed at 12:00 or 1:00.
: Why get up early at the weekend?
: I don't know. I actually don't like staying up late, but I do it for my job. It's strange I guess. On the weekends, some people like to sleep in. On the weekends, I like to go to bed early.
: Oh, my. At the weekend, I love to have a lie in bed. Sometimes I stay in bed all day and watch movies.
: Oh, you know, I'm guilty of that too. I do that also.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 4) When does she go to bed?
5) Who goes to bed early on the weekend?

hive_grammar.point: Point 1: You can use o'clock at the top of the hour, but often it is not spoken.

hive_text_custom.text: It is six o'clock. - It is six.
It is eight o'clock. - It is eight.
It is twelve o'clock. - It is twelve.
It is two o'clock. - It is two.

hive_grammar.point: Point 2: Twelve o'clock has two special names. Noon for daytime and midnight for night time.
Point 3: For time 30 minutes past the hour, you can use the term "half past".
Point 4: For time 15 minutes past the hour, you can use the term "a quarter past".
Point 5: For time 45 minutes past the hour, you can use the term "a quarter to/till".
